Class PoWNode

java.lang.Object
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.node.Node
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.node.PoWNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
IMiner, INode
public abstract class PoWNode extends Node implements IMiner
Abstract class representing a node in a blockchain network.
Author:
Sotirios Liaskos for the Conceptual Modeling Group @ York University

  • Method Details

    • startMining

      public void startMining(double interval)
      Starts mining with the specified expected mining interval. The interval may be based on when the next validation event takes place.
      Parameters:
      interval - The mining interval (in seconds).

    • startMining

      public void startMining()
      Starts mining without specifying an expected mining interval.

    • isMining

      public boolean isMining()
      Checks if the node is currently mining.
      Returns:
      true if the node is mining, false otherwise.

    • stopMining

      public void stopMining()
      Stops mining

    • getCostPerGH

      public double getCostPerGH()
      Returns the cost in conventional currency tokens in tokens/GH. Calculation is as follows: [ [electrictiyCost ($/kWh) * electricPower (W) / 1000 (W/kW)] / [3600 (s/h) * hashPower (GH/s)]] = [ [electrictiyCost ($/kWh) * electricPowerinkW (kW)] / [3600 (s/h) * hashPower (GH/s)]] = [ [electrictiyCostPerHour ($/h)] / [hashesPerHour (GH/h)]] = Tokens per billions of hashes ($/GH)
      Specified by:
      getCostPerGH in interface IMiner
      Returns:
      Cost in conventional currency tokens in tokens/GH.

    • setHashPower

      public void setHashPower(float hashpower)
      Sets the total hash power of the node in Gigahashes per second (GH/s).

    • getNextValidationEvent

      public Event getNextValidationEvent()
      Returns the next validation event associated with this node. Useful for removing the event when necessary.
      Returns:
      The next validation Event.

    • resetNextValidationEvent

      public void resetNextValidationEvent()
      Deletes the next validation event associated with this node. TODO: how does this affect cycle counting statistics?

    • scheduleValidationEvent

      public long scheduleValidationEvent(ITxContainer txc, long time)
      Schedules a validation event for the specified transaction container at the given time.
      Parameters:
      txc - The transaction container to be validated.
      time - The simulation time when the scheduling occurs. The even will be scheduled at `time + mining interval`.
      Returns:
      The scheduled mining interval in seconds.

    • event_NodeCompletesValidation

      public void event_NodeCompletesValidation(ITxContainer t, long time)
      Event: Node completes validation of a container. TODO: prospectiveMiningCycles must be removed from here, they are inaccurate, in cases of cancellation.
      Specified by:
      event_NodeCompletesValidation in interface INode
      Specified by:
      event_NodeCompletesValidation in class Node
      Parameters:
      t - The container for which validation is completed.
      time - The timestamp of the event.
